summary: Archaic Kinds Of Fun
title: Archaic Kinds Of Fun
body:
What’s the most impossible job you can think of? For Jo Holbrook, The Tank, Killer Extradonaire…it’s being a bodyguard. Leave it to Fury to kick it up a notch. Now she’s playing chauffeur for Tony Stark and trying to figure out where her life went wrong. At least there’s pancakes.

For The Record

November 1, 2014DARCY“Yo, Skye! You in here?!” Darcy called out as she walked into Tony’s lab. She heard music, and she knew Tony wasn’t playing it because he was out on a date with Pepper…

Read more…

summary: Vision picking up Mjölnir - does this tell us more about the hammer’s definition of “worthy” or does it tell us more about...
body:
Vision picking up Mjölnir - does this tell us more about the hammer’s definition of “worthy” or does it tell us more about Vision? Or what does it tell us about each?

Vision was just born/made - he hasn’t really done much. So does that mean that “worthy” here is an absence of certain “unworthy” flaws - like, one who can pick up the hammer does not have a certain characteristic of “unworthiness” or is not conquered by such? (Cause Thor in movie one might make me think otherwise.)

Or is it that Vision just being on “the side of life” makes him worthy? Does that hammer define worthiness by actions or internal values and abilities? Is it a positive (meaning actually present) trait or the absence of certain traits that hold you back? Or specifically not being controlled by those traits (like in the case of Thor, who had to overcome his immaturity and arrogance and selfishness and sole value of physical strength)?




Please share your opinions, I’m curious as to what people think.

summary: ANGEL (PART TWO)
title: ANGEL (PART TWO)
body:
A/N: It was between Loki and Steve for this one, so I went along and went with Steve. Sorry Loki, you have my heart– but the captain is gonna steal this one. Also, sorry Loki fans out there– I’ll make it up to you guys soon enough, promise! Unless… I change it up. Who knows, they might end up fighting for our reader, ay? Wink, wink. Let me know what you guys think. Hope you all like it! 

IMAGINE THIS!: reader is a victoria secret model and always have been running down the runway for the VS Fashion Show, unfortunately reader’s best friend– Tony Stark, never makes it to such events but would always invite him anyway and this time reader is extra nervous because she finds out the news that he’ll be able to finally make it to one of the shows, but he’s bringing the whole Avengers along with him. Talk about PRESSURE!

PART(S): ONE. TWO. 

PAIRING: CAPTAIN AMERICA/STEVE ROGERS X READER 

The night went along smoothly for you. You would usually excuse yourself from Tony’s team as you get pulled away from the group by your manager, wanting to introduce you to certain brands that would die for you to work for them, or by your friends who wanted to gush about the Avengers.

All you could really tell them was that you weren’t all too shy to approach them, which apparently they were. They were often approached by your friends which they politely spoke to, but they were more interested in speaking with you, mostly because you knew a lot of embarrassing life events of Tony before they met him. You and Tony had spoken about the idea of you being openly public about your relationship with him. To the world– you were simply an associate that he would talk to during after parties that he was invited to. No one really had caught you two spending time with each other outside of those parties. And Tony would like to keep it that way, for your safety.

He had put Pepper in a dangerous situation because of who he is, and he wasn’t going to drag you into it either, which you understood. You liked your privacy, as much as you like the fame and the fans that had worshipped your work– you wanted the privacy, wanted to act like a regular girl every now and then. You were careful during certain events where paparazzi were present, as much as you itched on spending time with your best friend– it was impossible. You thanked the stars that every single VS Fashion Show, the pap weren’t present as it was a private party, so you had as much time as you wanted to spend it with Tony– minus the part where you got dragged every now and then because your presence was wanted elsewhere.

During the night before you were able to return to Tony and his friends, you’ve stumbled upon a familiar face. You two stood a few feet away from Tony’s group, and you felt his eyes on you– probably wondering whom the heck you were with. Like you said, you were a very private person and speaking of your personal lovers wasn’t something you wanted to share to others, even Tony.

“Fancy seeing you here, Samuel.” You drawled, a brow arching in curiosity as you take in his appearance. He was still able to steal your breath away when he flashes you his smile. Right, Samuel George Claflin. The man before you was someone you had momentarily met a few months back– unfortunately, you two had rough patches that couldn’t be fixed and decided to walk out from each other’s lives. You, were moving along just nicely – while as he was, obviously not.

Ever so often you would cross paths and every chance he could get, he would drop the hint of getting back together which you pretended you didn’t notice, brushing him off. You weren’t ready for the step that he wanted to go with – which was to go public about the relationship. Though, he still tried but you both were on friendly terms.

“I wouldn’t miss this for the world, you know it. I’m always here to support you. Though, I’m surprised that your manager had invited me. Care to explain?” he asked and you could see the hope in your eyes. Damn, Mark! He has serious explaining to do, meddling in your relationships.

You shrugged in response as you flash him a small smile, “I’m just glad you’re here then. How have you been?”

“Actually, I prefer if we talk somewhere private. I just…” he trailed off. Oh boy, you knew where this was headed. “…think about it, okay? I know you still have my number and if not, I’ll message you to remind you if you don’t contact me in the next few days. Just think about it, we really need to talk things through without all the kicking and screaming from the both of us.”

You watched him, honestly quite shocked at his sincere desperate words. You knew Sam still wanted to get back together but you could see that it was literally killing him now; you felt your heart tug at the sight of him. You give him a nod and a small reassuring smile before leaning up to press a small kiss to his cheek with a mumble, “Of course, I’ll let you know.”

“Thank you, I’ll leave you then. You seem to be enjoying your time.” He whispered into your ear as he pulled you closer to him by your waist. “I wouldn’t want to ruin anything for you, you deserve to have the best night at the moment after your performance. You did wonderful, Y/N.”

You were blushing and sputtering thanks to Sam, you thought to yourself for a moment as you watched him depart from where he stood before you. You let out a grunt of distress, not really wanting to think about him– you were the kind of person who didn’t want to upset anyone, always wanting to go along the flow. Sam had meant everything to you and you were in cloud nine during the time, but the thought of going public scared you and you pulled away.

Deciding to push the thoughts of Sam away, you turned towards the direction of Tony and his friends and began approaching with that smile of yours again. You were instantly greeted once more with glee.

“And who was that you were talking to, hmmm?” the one that had introduced herself as Natasha, gushed in a teasing manner. Curiosity sparkling in her eyes as she tried to push you for answers, Tony clearly was not amused at the subject.

“You never told me you had a boyfriend.” He said with a raised brow, crossing his arms across his chest as he tried to look disappointed. You chuckled.

“He’s not my boyfriend, well– not anymore at least.” You said with a shrug of your shoulders. “We ended a couple of months ago.”

“It doesn’t look like it, Y/N.” Natasha teased, giggling to herself– obviously the alcohol had already taken over most of her control.

Your eyes flickered from each teammate who were just as curious as Tony, waiting for you to speak more of the matter, “Honestly, we’re over but– but it’s only been a couple of months since then. I don’t know, maybe there’s still something there.”

“To hell with that!” Tony snapped like the overprotective older brother you had gotten used to. You shook your head at him, “You’re not going out with anyone. Period.”

“Why don’t you look at that, metal man being the overprotective father.”

“Shut it, Reindeer Games.” Tony barked, causing you and the team to erupt into laughter. “I’m just saying, if you’re going to at least date someone– it should be someone like, oh I don’t know our ol’ Captain America over here, Steve.” He said casually, his eyes never leaving yours as he pats Steve on the back that sat next to him.

You groaned inwardly, fighting the blush that wanted to creep across your cheeks. You are so dead, Stark. You put your best poker face on, not wanting to give anything away. “I don’t think you have the say on who I go out with, Tony.” You said coolly, not wanting to break your gaze from Tony. You couldn’t risk looking over at Steve and exposing your secret.

“Plus, why Steve? Why not me?” the person you’ve come to know as Bucky spoke from next to you; a grin now spreading on your lips.

“Or Me.” the one Tony called ‘Reindeer Games’ spoke up. What was his name? Ah yes, Loki.

Tony looks at them as if they just asked a stupid question and you couldn’t help but snicker at the sight. He broke his gaze from you and looked over to the man that sat next you, “You need to prove it to me that you are worthy of such privilege of becoming Y/N’s boyfriend, she’s family this one.” He said before turning to look over at Loki with a brow raised, “You almost killed all of us, I’m not letting you near her.”

Laughter was all that was heard from the group after that and you couldn’t deny that spending time was them was the most fun you had in years, you were glad that Tony was still someone you can call family. As the night passed by, most of your friends had already left. And you decided that it was probably best for you to make your departure as well.

“What? The night’s still young, Lady Y/N!” Thor boomed, clearly disappointed at my announcement.

“I have to agree with Thunder Man.” Tony shrugged as he leaned back against the booth, “Why don’t you come join us back at the tower for the night? We have extra rooms. We can have our own little party there.”

You pressed your lips to a thin line, in thought. You didn’t have any plans tomorrow since you made sure to instruct Mark not to do any bookings as to enjoy a relaxing day off after the show. “I don’t know…”

“Come on, we haven’t seen each other in a while!” Tony said, practically begging now. Ah, there was the Tony you adored.

“Yeah, Y/N. It’ll be fun.” Steve said, flashing you a smile and damn, you just wanted to melt right there or scream like a little girl.

“Alright, fine– but I am so not drinking anymore, nor should you let Natasha.” You said, pointing towards a nearly passed out Natasha at the corner.

As you said goodbyes to certain people, including Mark– who gave you a stern look and gave you the famous talk; “I’m expecting you back at your penthouse by lunch tomorrow, and if you’re not home by then– I swear, I’ll drag you out of that tower myself. We have important matters to discuss on your upcoming projects!” Oh you wouldn’t know what to do with Mark as your manager, you weren’t as organized as he was.

Moving to the Avenger Tower was easy, Tony made sure of that. Paparazzi was still around waiting for the remaining guests to leave just in case there was something scandalous like what you were doing, leaving with the Avengers. Thankfully they made sure you left the building unseen, apparently it had something to do with Loki but you weren’t sure what exactly it was. All you knew is that you weren’t seen and now you were all huddled around their living area, laughing and joking around.

“Okay, let’s play a game. Truth or Dare, anyone?” Tony suggested from his seat.

“What are you, a kid?” I asked, a laugh leaving my lips. Oh, I know you well enough to know what you’re planning! Once I get Tony alone, I swear I’ll choke him!

“Oh come on, Y/N! Live a little, it’s just a silly game.” Natasha gushed from her seat. After awhile, Natasha finally recovered from all the alcohol and was slowly returning back to her normal self. You held your hands up in the air as a sign you weren’t going to protest any longer.

“Okay, Tony we’ll start with you since you thought about it. Truth or Dare?” Natasha asked.

“Truth.” He shrugged. There were boos coming from most of you who were seated on the loveseat. You were squished between Steve and Bucky. “Oh, shut up.”

“Okay, is it true that when you were a kid someone practically shoved their bare butt in your face and your cried for your mother?” Natasha asked, teasingly.

“Y/N! You need to stop sharing them these!” Tony snapped at the memory, shooting you a glare and all you could do, well– mostly everyone was burst into laughter. That was all the confirmation they needed. You were laughing so hard that you held onto your sides, barely noticing that you leaned against Steve who stiffened next to you. “Think it’s funny, do you? Oh okay, Y/N you’re next. Truth or Dare.”

You wiped the almost tears that wanted to come out from all of your laughing as you try to regain your composure. Sticking your tongue out at him playfully, you shrugged as you spoke, “Uhm, okay. Dare.”

Your eyes widened at your own answer. Fuck. You knew where this was going as Tony’s lips twitched to a smile. “Okay, I dare you to kiss Captain.” He said with a shrug. “Unless you’re too chicken.” You shoot a glare towards Tony’s direction and he just smiled at you innocently. Looking over at Steve who was suddenly tense next to you. You heard Tony who was suddenly making chicken noises and you wanted to hurt him more than ever now. He knew you too much that pushing you got on your nerves.

“It’s okay, Y/N you don’t have to–” you cut Steve off with your lips pressing against his and his eyes widen at the action. For a minute you thought he was going to pull away but then butterflies fill your stomach as he pulls you to him closer; deepening the kiss between you and you felt his arm wrap around your waist.

Well, fuck.

Pulling away, you didn’t even care to understand what Tony was blabbering about in the background. All you could do was look up at Steve, slightly dizzy at what just had happened. He just flashed you a small smile, stop being so charming!

“Yeah, Y/N. It’ll be fun.” Steve said, flashing you a smile and damn, you just wanted to melt right there or scream like a little girl.

“Alright, fine– but I am so not drinking anymore, nor should you let Natasha.” You said, pointing towards a nearly passed out Natasha at the corner.

As you said goodbyes to certain people, including Mark– who gave you a stern look and gave you the famous talk; “I’m expecting you back at your penthouse by lunch tomorrow, and if you’re not home by then– I swear, I’ll drag you out of that tower myself. We have important matters to discuss on your upcoming projects!” Oh you wouldn’t know what to do with Mark as your manager, you weren’t as organized as he was.

Moving to the Avenger Tower was easy, Tony made sure of that. Paparazzi was still around waiting for the remaining guests to leave just in case there was something scandalous like what you were doing, leaving with the Avengers. Thankfully they made sure you left the building unseen, apparently it had something to do with Loki but you weren’t sure what exactly it was. All you knew is that you weren’t seen and now you were all huddled around their living area, laughing and joking around.

“Okay, let’s play a game. Truth or Dare, anyone?” Tony suggested from his seat.

“What are you, a kid?” I asked, a laugh leaving my lips. Oh, I know you well enough to know what you’re planning! Once I get Tony alone, I swear I’ll choke him!

“Oh come on, Y/N! Live a little, it’s just a silly game.” Natasha gushed from her seat. After awhile, Natasha finally recovered from all the alcohol and was slowly returning back to her normal self. You held your hands up in the air as a sign you weren’t going to protest any longer.

“Okay, Tony we’ll start with you since you thought about it. Truth or Dare?” Natasha asked.

“Truth.” He shrugged. There were boos coming from most of you who were seated on the loveseat. You were squished between Steve and Bucky. “Oh, shut up.”

“Okay, is it true that when you were a kid someone practically shoved their bare butt in your face and your cried for your mother?” Natasha asked, teasingly.

“Y/N! You need to stop sharing them these!” Tony snapped at the memory, shooting you a glare and all you could do, well– mostly everyone was burst into laughter. That was all the confirmation they needed. You were laughing so hard that you held onto your sides, barely noticing that you leaned against Steve who stiffened next to you. “Think it’s funny, do you? Oh okay, Y/N you’re next. Truth or Dare.”

You wiped the almost tears that wanted to come out from all of your laughing as you try to regain your composure. Sticking your tongue out at him playfully, you shrugged as you spoke, “Uhm, okay. Dare.”

Your eyes widened at your own answer. Fuck. You knew where this was going as Tony’s lips twitched to a smile. “Okay, I dare you to kiss Captain.” He said with a shrug. “Unless you’re too chicken.” You shoot a glare towards Tony’s direction and he just smiled at you innocently. Looking over at Steve who was suddenly tense next to you. You heard Tony who was suddenly making chicken noises and you wanted to hurt him more than ever now. He knew you too much that pushing you got on your nerves.

“It’s okay, Y/N you don’t have to–” you cut Steve off with your lips pressing against his and his eyes widen at the action. For a minute you thought he was going to pull away but then butterflies fill your stomach as he pulls you to him closer; deepening the kiss between you and you felt his arm wrap around your waist.

Well, fuck.

Pulling away, you didn’t even care to understand what Tony was blabbering about in the background. All you could do was look up at Steve, slightly dizzy at what just had happened. He just flashed you a small smile, stop being so charming!
trail.content:
A/N: It was between Loki and Steve for this one, so I went along and went with Steve. Sorry Loki, you have my heart– but the captain is gonna steal this one. Also, sorry Loki fans out there– I’ll make it up to you guys soon enough, promise! Unless… I change it up. Who knows, they might end up fighting for our reader, ay? Wink, wink. Let me know what you guys think. Hope you all like it! 

IMAGINE THIS!: reader is a victoria secret model and always have been running down the runway for the VS Fashion Show, unfortunately reader’s best friend– Tony Stark, never makes it to such events but would always invite him anyway and this time reader is extra nervous because she finds out the news that he’ll be able to finally make it to one of the shows, but he’s bringing the whole Avengers along with him. Talk about PRESSURE!

PART(S): ONE. TWO. 

PAIRING: CAPTAIN AMERICA/STEVE ROGERS X READER 

The night went along smoothly for you. You would usually excuse yourself from Tony’s team as you get pulled away from the group by your manager, wanting to introduce you to certain brands that would die for you to work for them, or by your friends who wanted to gush about the Avengers.

All you could really tell them was that you weren’t all too shy to approach them, which apparently they were. They were often approached by your friends which they politely spoke to, but they were more interested in speaking with you, mostly because you knew a lot of embarrassing life events of Tony before they met him. You and Tony had spoken about the idea of you being openly public about your relationship with him. To the world– you were simply an associate that he would talk to during after parties that he was invited to. No one really had caught you two spending time with each other outside of those parties. And Tony would like to keep it that way, for your safety.

He had put Pepper in a dangerous situation because of who he is, and he wasn’t going to drag you into it either, which you understood. You liked your privacy, as much as you like the fame and the fans that had worshipped your work– you wanted the privacy, wanted to act like a regular girl every now and then. You were careful during certain events where paparazzi were present, as much as you itched on spending time with your best friend– it was impossible. You thanked the stars that every single VS Fashion Show, the pap weren’t present as it was a private party, so you had as much time as you wanted to spend it with Tony– minus the part where you got dragged every now and then because your presence was wanted elsewhere.

During the night before you were able to return to Tony and his friends, you’ve stumbled upon a familiar face. You two stood a few feet away from Tony’s group, and you felt his eyes on you– probably wondering whom the heck you were with. Like you said, you were a very private person and speaking of your personal lovers wasn’t something you wanted to share to others, even Tony.

“Fancy seeing you here, Samuel.” You drawled, a brow arching in curiosity as you take in his appearance. He was still able to steal your breath away when he flashes you his smile. Right, Samuel George Claflin. The man before you was someone you had momentarily met a few months back– unfortunately, you two had rough patches that couldn’t be fixed and decided to walk out from each other’s lives. You, were moving along just nicely – while as he was, obviously not.

Ever so often you would cross paths and every chance he could get, he would drop the hint of getting back together which you pretended you didn’t notice, brushing him off. You weren’t ready for the step that he wanted to go with – which was to go public about the relationship. Though, he still tried but you both were on friendly terms.

“I wouldn’t miss this for the world, you know it. I’m always here to support you. Though, I’m surprised that your manager had invited me. Care to explain?” he asked and you could see the hope in your eyes. Damn, Mark! He has serious explaining to do, meddling in your relationships.

You shrugged in response as you flash him a small smile, “I’m just glad you’re here then. How have you been?”

“Actually, I prefer if we talk somewhere private. I just…” he trailed off. Oh boy, you knew where this was headed. “…think about it, okay? I know you still have my number and if not, I’ll message you to remind you if you don’t contact me in the next few days. Just think about it, we really need to talk things through without all the kicking and screaming from the both of us.”

You watched him, honestly quite shocked at his sincere desperate words. You knew Sam still wanted to get back together but you could see that it was literally killing him now; you felt your heart tug at the sight of him. You give him a nod and a small reassuring smile before leaning up to press a small kiss to his cheek with a mumble, “Of course, I’ll let you know.”

“Thank you, I’ll leave you then. You seem to be enjoying your time.” He whispered into your ear as he pulled you closer to him by your waist. “I wouldn’t want to ruin anything for you, you deserve to have the best night at the moment after your performance. You did wonderful, Y/N.”

You were blushing and sputtering thanks to Sam, you thought to yourself for a moment as you watched him depart from where he stood before you. You let out a grunt of distress, not really wanting to think about him– you were the kind of person who didn’t want to upset anyone, always wanting to go along the flow. Sam had meant everything to you and you were in cloud nine during the time, but the thought of going public scared you and you pulled away.

Deciding to push the thoughts of Sam away, you turned towards the direction of Tony and his friends and began approaching with that smile of yours again. You were instantly greeted once more with glee.

“And who was that you were talking to, hmmm?” the one that had introduced herself as Natasha, gushed in a teasing manner. Curiosity sparkling in her eyes as she tried to push you for answers, Tony clearly was not amused at the subject.

“You never told me you had a boyfriend.” He said with a raised brow, crossing his arms across his chest as he tried to look disappointed. You chuckled.

“He’s not my boyfriend, well– not anymore at least.” You said with a shrug of your shoulders. “We ended a couple of months ago.”

“It doesn’t look like it, Y/N.” Natasha teased, giggling to herself– obviously the alcohol had already taken over most of her control.

Your eyes flickered from each teammate who were just as curious as Tony, waiting for you to speak more of the matter, “Honestly, we’re over but– but it’s only been a couple of months since then. I don’t know, maybe there’s still something there.”

“To hell with that!” Tony snapped like the overprotective older brother you had gotten used to. You shook your head at him, “You’re not going out with anyone. Period.”

“Why don’t you look at that, metal man being the overprotective father.”

“Shut it, Reindeer Games.” Tony barked, causing you and the team to erupt into laughter. “I’m just saying, if you’re going to at least date someone– it should be someone like, oh I don’t know our ol’ Captain America over here, Steve.” He said casually, his eyes never leaving yours as he pats Steve on the back that sat next to him.

You groaned inwardly, fighting the blush that wanted to creep across your cheeks. You are so dead, Stark. You put your best poker face on, not wanting to give anything away. “I don’t think you have the say on who I go out with, Tony.” You said coolly, not wanting to break your gaze from Tony. You couldn’t risk looking over at Steve and exposing your secret.

“Plus, why Steve? Why not me?” the person you’ve come to know as Bucky spoke from next to you; a grin now spreading on your lips.

“Or Me.” the one Tony called ‘Reindeer Games’ spoke up. What was his name? Ah yes, Loki.

Tony looks at them as if they just asked a stupid question and you couldn’t help but snicker at the sight. He broke his gaze from you and looked over to the man that sat next you, “You need to prove it to me that you are worthy of such privilege of becoming Y/N’s boyfriend, she’s family this one.” He said before turning to look over at Loki with a brow raised, “You almost killed all of us, I’m not letting you near her.”

Laughter was all that was heard from the group after that and you couldn’t deny that spending time was them was the most fun you had in years, you were glad that Tony was still someone you can call family. As the night passed by, most of your friends had already left. And you decided that it was probably best for you to make your departure as well.

“What? The night’s still young, Lady Y/N!” Thor boomed, clearly disappointed at my announcement.

“I have to agree with Thunder Man.” Tony shrugged as he leaned back against the booth, “Why don’t you come join us back at the tower for the night? We have extra rooms. We can have our own little party there.”
